intro: Urticastrum divaricatum, commonly known as the narrowleaf sandverbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white to pale blue flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Urticastrum divaricatum is adapted to withstand drought and heat, making it a hardy species in its native range.
